intro: Anemia seemannii, commonly known as the red sanders, is a rare and endangered species native to the arid regions of northern Australia. It is a small, shrub-like plant with thick, fleshy leaves adapted to store water in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves and stems contain a high concentration of essential oils, which have been used in traditional medicine. Due to overharvesting and habitat loss, it is critically endangered and protected under various conservation laws.
